hpnicfDhcpSnoop.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoop
hpnicfDhcpSnoop.description: The private MIB file includes the DHCP Snooping profile.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopTable.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopTable
hpnicfDhcpSnoopTable.description: The table containing information of DHCP clients listened by DHCP snooping and it's enabled or disabled by setting hpnicfDhcpSnoopEnable node.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopEntry.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopEntry
hpnicfDhcpSnoopEntry.description: An entry containing information of DHCP clients.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientIpAddressType.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientIpAddressType
hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientIpAddressType.description: DHCP clients' IP addresses type (IPv4 or IPv6).

hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientIpAddress.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientIpAddress
hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientIpAddress.description: DHCP clients' IP addresses collected by DHCP snooping.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientMacAddress.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientMacAddress
hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientMacAddress.description: DHCP clients' MAC addresses collected by DHCP snooping.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientProperty.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientProperty
hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientProperty.description: Method of getting IP addresses collected by DHCP snooping.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientUnitNum.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientUnitNum
hpnicfDhcpSnoopClientUnitNum.description: IRF (Intelligent Resilient Fabric) unit number via whom the clients get their IP addresses. The value 0 means this device does not support IRF.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopTrustTable.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopTrustTable
hpnicfDhcpSnoopTrustTable.description: A table is used to configure and monitor port trusted status.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopTrustEntry.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopTrustEntry
hpnicfDhcpSnoopTrustEntry.description: An entry containing information about trusted status of ports.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopTrustStatus.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopTrustStatus
hpnicfDhcpSnoopTrustStatus.description: Trusted status of current port which supports both get and set operation.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopVlanTable.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopVlanTable
hpnicfDhcpSnoopVlanTable.description: A table is used to configure and monitor DHCP Snooping status of VLANs.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopVlanEnable.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopVlanEnable
hpnicfDhcpSnoopVlanEnable.description: DHCP Snooping status of current VLAN.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopSpoofServerMac.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopSpoofServerMac
hpnicfDhcpSnoopSpoofServerMac.description: MAC address of the spoofing server and it is derived from link-layer header of offer packet. If the offer packet is relayed by dhcp relay entity, it may be the MAC address of relay entity.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopSpoofServerIP.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopSpoofServerIP
hpnicfDhcpSnoopSpoofServerIP.description: IP address of the spoofing server and it is derived from IP header of offer packet. A tricksy host may send offer packet use other host's address, so this address can not always be trust.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopBindingIP.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopBindingIP
hpnicfDhcpSnoopBindingIP.description: IP address of a new binding.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopBindingMac.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopBindingMac
hpnicfDhcpSnoopBindingMac.description: MAC address of a new binding.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopSpoofServerDetected.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopSpoofServerDetected
hpnicfDhcpSnoopSpoofServerDetected.description: To detect unauthorized DHCP servers on a network, the DHCP snooping device sends DHCP-DISCOVER messages through its downstream port (which is connected to the DHCP clients). If any response (DHCP-OFFER message) is received from the downstream port, an unauthorized DHCP server is considered present, and then the device sends a trap. With unauthorized DHCP server detection enabled, the interface sends a DHCP-DISCOVER message to detect unauthorized DHCP servers on the network. If this interface receives a DHCP-OFFER message, the DHCP server which sent it is considered unauthorized.

hpnicfDhcpSnoopNewBinding.name: hpnicfDhcpSnoopNewBinding
hpnicfDhcpSnoopNewBinding.description: The device sends a trap when adding a new binding.
